name: CrediBook
headline: Faire for Indonesia
description:
CrediBook digitizes the MSMEs' supply chain, from wholesale to retail, through online wholesale and bookkeeping operation system.

Our online wholesale platform CrediMart aims to create an efficient inventory-sourcing. We provide online-ordering, Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) payment method, and logistic support. We help our wholesale partners earn an additional daily income stream by 50%.

Our bookkeeping app CrediBook also enables MSMEs generate financial report in less than 5 minutes and proven to speed up users’ micro-loans process from financial institutions.
CrediBook strives to encourage more MSMEs to benefit digitalization from easy and efficient platforms that meet their needs.

founders.name: Gabriel Frans, Founder
founders.description:
Co-founder and CEO of CrediBook. Product guy at heart.
An avid musician and music producer, also enjoy playing a lot of games (competitively).

founders.name: Dekha Anggareska, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder and CTO of CrediBook. 8+ experience in software engineering. Love to create product from scratch. Besides occasional tinkering with engineering, likes to play badminton and football.

founders.name: Christian Lie, Founder
founders.description:
Christ is a Co-Founder & COO at CrediBook who has 8+ years of experience in the SMEs area.
Focus on handling Sales Operation & Marketing. Prior to this company, he has worked as a Head of Regional manager at PAYFAZZ helped the company expand through all java. He also joined PAYFAZZ in the early days and assist the company to shape the product from the customer and build an initial sales strategy the company grows 10x within a year.

generated_description:
### CrediBook: Empowering MSMEs in Indonesia

**Mission**: CrediBook is on a mission to make business operations fairer for Indonesian MSMEs (Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises) through digital transformation.

**Overview**: Founded in 2020 and part of Y Combinator's Batch W22, CrediBook has set its sights on revolutionizing how MSMEs manage their supply chains, bookkeeping, and wholesale processes in Indonesia. Based in Jakarta, the company has a diverse team of 53 individuals, led by Group Partner Gustaf Alstromer.

**What They Do**:
1. **CrediMart**: An online wholesale platform designed to streamline inventory sourcing for MSMEs. It offers features like online ordering, a Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) payment option, and logistical support. This platform has enabled wholesale partners to increase their daily income by up to 50%.
   
2. **CrediBook App**: This bookkeeping tool helps MSMEs generate financial reports in under five minutes. It significantly reduces the time required for micro-loan processing, making it easier for businesses to access needed funds.

**Impact**: CrediBook has made impressive strides:
- Over **745,000 registered users** utilize their services across **330,000+ growing businesses** in more than **30 cities**.
- Testimonials highlight significant improvements, with users reporting a 90% increase in turnover after integrating with CrediMart.

**Funding**: CrediBook recently secured **$8.1 million** in Series A funding, paving the way for further expansion and the enhancement of their digital services in the wholesale sector.

**Backers**: The company is backed by notable investors, including Alpha JWC Ventures, Insignia Ventures Partners, Monk's Hill Ventures, Wavemaker Partners, and Fazz Financial.

**Featured In**: CrediBook has garnered attention in various media outlets, including Jakarta Post, Tech in Asia, Kompas, and Kontan, thanks to its proactive approach in supporting digitalization for MSMEs in Indonesia.

**Website**: For more information, visit [CrediBook's official website](https://credibook.com).

As CrediBook continues to develop its offerings, it aims not just to digitize operations but to facilitate a broader shift towards a more equitable and efficient business landscape for all Indonesian MSMEs.
